page.title: 06Brightlingsea Creek
page.content: Brightlingsea Creek runs from{The {Hard,}along past the new wharf,beside the oyster pits down to St. Osyth.Many locally built boats are launched from The Hard including Catarmarans built by Olympic Gold Medalist,{Reg White. Hundreds of small pleasure craft are moored alongside Cindery Island as well as ,still, a few small fishing trawlers.{The New Wharf}has been very busy of late with many 150 ft. ships unloading coal. It is very unpopular locally because of all the lorry traffic using the local roads. {The Oyster Pits}are very old and {E.P.Dicken's}book on The History of Brightlingsea states that they were established by 1200 A.D. and a major local industry.Since 1930 the pits have fallen into decay and now form an interesting biological feature as the sea steadily reclaims the land.
